sub_title: R&D Engineer, UWB and IoT Solutions at imec
summary:
I have always been enthralled by the idea of making Things "talk". A strong background in Wireless Sensor Networks, Embedded systems and Computer Networking has made me realize the potential of the Internet of Things (IoT) where Things "talk" to each other and make our world Smarter than ever before!

A total of 6+ years of work experience subsuming Software Development, Networking, Cyber-Physical Systems and Wireless Communication domains has equipped me with a diverse skillset required to design and develop embedded system solutions for a targeted use case. 
A demonstrated experience in building IoT-based solutions starting from the concept till the end product has made me confident in addressing the technical challenges involved in embedded system development.
Valuable research aptitude and analytical skills acquired during my research at the Chair of Communication Networks at TU Munich have aided my crisp thinking and strategic decision-making.
I enjoy leading customer interactions and orchestrating fruitful collaborations to drive business goals.

I look forward to exercising my technical and professional abilities in building impactful solutions and doing my bit to make the world "Smarter".

Technical Skillset:
Domains: Software development, Embedded systems, Robotics, Sensor networks, Wireless communication, IoT, Communication Networks, Software Defined Networking, Linux and Microsoft Azure.
Programming languages: C, C++, Assembly, Python, Tcl and Ada.
Rapid prototyping: Raspberry Pi, Arduino, BrickPi, Pycom, nRF, Zolertia, WiFi, Zigbee.
Others: Firmware development, Platform bring-up, Test Automation, Version Control Systems, Real-Time Systems and Cloud architecture.

projects.title: Benchmarking of Networked Control Systems for Robotics
projects.description:
Quantifying the performance of a Networked Control System (NCS) is a challenging task as it involves intricacies from both Network and Control domains. An Inverted Pendulum Robot using LEGOMindstorms sensors and BrickPi, working over an NCS (WiFi and Ethernet) is built and the involved NCS is benchmarked using the NCSBench platform. Key Performance Indicators of the Robot are analyzed and improved to achieve a faster and less error-prone control system operation. 
Tools: BrickPi, LEGO Mindstorms, Raspbian OS for Robots, Matplotlib, Sensors and Actuators.

Reference: Reproducible Benchmarking Platform for Networked Control Systems
https://github.com/tum-lkn/NCSbench/wiki

contributors.headline: R&D Engineer, UWB and IoT Solutions at imec

projects.title: Optimized Trash collection technique using ZigBee mesh networks
projects.description:
An IOT based solution to monitor trash cans in a city using ZigBee mesh networks and GSM technology. With the environmental awareness increasing day by day, need for a cleaner environment is becoming a priority for which, Trash management of an area plays a very important role. With the demand for waste collection rising and city budgets shrinking, innovation is required. 
In this project, Trash collection is optimized using Wireless sensor Networks. A network of Trashcans is built, wherein Trashcans talk to each other, sense their status and provide information to the concerned authority about the steps to be taken. Each Trash collection unit sends a wireless signal to a central server where staff can see which machines are full, so managers can optimize collection routes in real-time based on data from every machine in the field. 
Tools: ZigBee, XBee, GSM Module, Arduino, Embedded C, IR Sensor, Ultrasonic sensor

projects.title: Remote Medical Diagnostics using RF
projects.description:
The project illustrates the concept of tele medicine by demonstrating a heart rate monitor system based on microcontroller. The data is transmitted using RF module. This offers the advantage of remote medical diagnosis. It demonstrates how a single-chip microcontroller can be used to analyze heart rate in real-time. IR led is used as a source and a photodiode is used as a sensor. The heart rate in beats per minute is counted by the microcontroller and then it is transmitted using RF module. The receiver receives this data and displays the heart rate on the display unit.
Tools: Arduino, IR Sensor, RF Module, LCD.

projects.title: Video Surveillance Using Cell Phone Operated Land Rover
projects.description:
Built a four-wheel landrover equipped with a Mobile phone with cellular connectivity.
DTMF tones transmitted over the cellular network to the mobile phone housed in the rover is used to remotely control the rover. Camera built into the cell phone on the landrover, with the assistance of an android app, is used for video surveillance.
Demonstrated successful steering and direction control of the rover, over a call to the landrover's mobile phone. Also, set up the live streaming over IP from rover's mobile phone.
Tools: Microcontroller, Motor driver, DTMF, Cellular communication, IP based Video Survelliance

projects.title: Neural Network to classify Human Gait Phases
projects.description:
An Artificial Neural Network(ANN) application which uses the wearable sensor data to classify human walking phases(Gait Phases). An inertial sensor mounted on the foot of the subject wirelessly transmits data to the embedded platform running ANN application, which then identifies the current gait phase.
Tools: Raspberry Pi, IMU inertial sensor, WiFi, Tensorflow, Keras, Grafana, Python, Machine Learning.

projects.description:
A project to get familiarized with the constructs and features of a Real-Time Programming language called Ada. A phone book application is implemented in Ada programming language using typical language constructs, Real-Time annex, Tasking and verified using SPARK language.

projects.title: Power Supply Prioritised Routing Protocol for IoT
projects.description:
Design and implementation of a routing protocol for Wireless Sensor Networks to achieve longer operation cycles for energy constrained sensor nodes. The designed routing protocol working with sensor rich Home Automation solution was successfully demonstrated using Zolertia motes.
Tools: Contiki OS, Cooja, UART, Qt Framework, Multi-threading, Embedded C

contributors.headline: R&D Engineer, UWB and IoT Solutions at imec

projects.title: Elastic Distributed Controller Architecture for SDN Paradigm
projects.description:
Implementation of an elastic distributed controller architecture which addresses the load imbalance caused due to spatial and temporal variations in the traffic conditions. This Elastic controller architecture automatically balances the load across controllers thus ensuring optimum performance irrespective of the traffic dynamics. The load shifting is carried out through a well-defined migration protocol adhering to OpenFlow standards.  
Tools: OpenFlow, Mininet, Python, MongoDB, Ryu SDN Framework

Reference: 
ElastiCon: An Elastic Distributed SDN Controller

projects.title: Discrete Event Network Simulator using Python
projects.description:
Implementation of a Discrete Event Simulator of GI/GI/1/S/∞ queuing system using object-oriented programming in Python. The implemented simulator is capable of simulating the selected arrival and service processes, specified queue lengths for an afore-mentioned length of time and give out metrics like blocking probability, average queue length, average waiting time of a packet and system utilization.  The simulator is capable of providing various statistics like Autocorrelation of Waiting times of packets, Cross-correlation between simulation results like arrival time, service time, and queue length, Confidence intervals for the system throughput and Results of chi-squared tests.
Tools: Python, Matplotlib

profile_positions.description:
Software development for imec’s proprietary Ultra Wideband (UWB) platform.
System integration involving multi-disciplinary collaboration across Analog, Digital, and Signal processing domains to build ranging and radar demonstrations.
Architecting automation infra for radio performance evaluation.
Solutions engineering for Smart City initiative with a broad spectrum of tasks, including Embedded Firmware development, Cloud infrastructure design (Microsoft Azure) and Data Engineering.
Drive customer interactions and partner collaborations to achieve strategic business goals.
profile_positions.title: R&D Engineer, IoT Solutions

profile_positions.description:
Design and implementation of Time Slotted Channel Hopping (TSCH) scheduling techniques for Wireless Sensor Networks. 
Tailoring TSCH (MAC Layer) operation to suit the requirements of Networked Control Systems and Robotics employed in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks.
Verification of the impact of network parameters on the KPIs of Networked Control Systems built using RaspberryPi, sensors, actuators along with EV3Dev robots equipped with wired and wireless communications.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant - Wireless Sensor Networks

profile_positions.description: Design and Implementation of safety and security measures in an Industry 4.0 infrastructure using Image Processing (OpenCV), Machine to Machine communication (OPC UA), Distributed Industrial Automation Framework (4diac) and Software Defined Networking (Openflow).
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant - Industry 4.0

profile_positions.description: Design of sensor circuits and development of Embedded System software for IoT use cases. Design of Cyber-Physical Systems for Smart Factory solutions.
profile_positions.title: Embedded Developer

profile_positions.description:
Developed platform software for ASR1000 line of products. Contributed to the development/ enablement of Optical modular transceivers (SFP), Shared Port Adapters (SPA), Ethernet Port Adapters (EPA), IO handling ASICs and Ternary Content Addressable Memory (TCAM).
Tested network modules for ISR line of products and performed a rigorous evaluation of Link Layer Discovery Protocol, MLD snooping, Channelized Network Interface modules and automated test cases using Tcl and Python.
Participated in several hackathons and also won a global level hackathon for the idea 'Smart City Assist'.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
The National Institute of Engineering took the privilege to host the  zonal level Robotic workshop/competition ROBOTRYST 2014 supported by Robosapiens Technologies Pvt Ltd on 27th and 28th of September 2013. The event was organised by the dept of E&C, sponsored by TEQIP.
The workshop threw light upon the basic elements of Robotics and provided a hands on exposure for the participants. Workshop was followed by the zonal level competition.
techNIEks, the annual techno-cultural extravaganza, organized by the National Institute of Engineering, Mysore which includes various state level competitions and events.
Volunteered for the 'GRS Talent Star - 2012' a quizzing based corporate social responsibility program for an amusement park, covering 20,000 students spread across 60 secondary schools.

Building scientific models for school children to help them understand scientific concepts better.
Volunteering at ISKCON's midday meal initiative for school children - Akshaya Patra.
Volunteering at old age homes and hospice centers.
